Name: DI-N-OCTYL ADIPATE
Description: Dioctyl hexanedioate is a carboxylic ester.

environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Felder JD et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 5: 777-84 (1986) (2) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: A whole-fish BCF of 27 was observed for blue-gill fish exposed di-n-octyl adipate levels of 250 ug/l for a 28-day period(1). According to a classification scheme(2), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is low.

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Felder JD et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 5: 777-84 (1986)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: AEROBIC: In a semi-continuous activated sludge method used to simulate sewage treatment plant biodegradation, di-n-octyl adipate was observed to undergo primary degradation of 65-96% (at concns of 5 and 20 mg/l added/24 hr)(1); in a CO2 evolution study, di-n-octyl adipate was observed to biodegrade 94% over a 35-day incubation period which corresponds to a first-order half-life of 2.7 days(1).

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Lefaux, R. Practical Toxicology of Plastics. Cleveland: CRC Press Inc., 1968., p. 358
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: NO ACUTE EFFECT HAS BEEN OBSERVED SOME HR AFTER ORAL ADMIN TO GUINEA PIGS OF DOSES ... EQUAL TO OR LESS THAN 14 ML/KG BODY WT. YET IN SUCCEEDING DAYS (3-21 DAYS) HALF OF ANIMALS DIED.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Lefaux, R. Practical Toxicology of Plastics. Cleveland: CRC Press Inc., 1968., p. 358
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ... DOSES OF 5 ML/KG /ADMIN TO GUINEA PIGS/ DID NOT CAUSE ANY MORTALITY, WHILE WITH 20 ML/KG, ALL ANIMALS ULTIMATELY SUCCUMBED IN ENSUING WEEKS. DEATH WAS PRECEDED BY PROGRESSIVE INFEEBLEMENT & MUSCULAR ATROPHY ... .

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Lefaux, R. Practical Toxicology of Plastics. Cleveland: CRC Press Inc., 1968., p. 359
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: IN LONG-TERM TOXICITY TESTS, DAILY DOSES OF ADIPATE 0.61 MG/KG BODY WT HAVE NOT CAUSED ANY REACTION IN RATS AFTER NINETY DAYS.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Lewis, R.J. Sax's Dangerous Properties of Industrial Materials. 9th ed. Volumes 1-3. New York, NY: Van Nostrand Reinhold, 1996., p. 71
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: Moderately toxic by intravenous route. Mildly toxic by ingestion. An eye and skin irritant.

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Hites RA, Biemann WG; Adv Chem Ser 147: 188-210 (1975)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Dioctyl adipate (isomer not reported) was detected (concn not reported) in sediment collected from the Charles River in Boston in Sept 1973(1).

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Meylan WM et al; Environ Sci Technol 26: 1560-67 (1992) (2) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Using a structure estimation method based on molecular connectivity indices(1), the Koc for di-n-octyl adipate can be estimated to be 57,000(SRC). According to a classification scheme(2), this estimated Koc value suggests that di-n-octyl adipate is expected to be immobile in soil.
